remarks: Define the class of all complex inner product spaces.  An inner product space is a normed vector space whose norm satisfies the parallelogram law (a property that induces an inner product).  Based on Exercise 4(b) of [ReedSimon] p. 63.  The vector operation is ` g ` , the scalar product is ` s ` , and the norm is ` n ` .  An inner product space is also called a pre-Hilbert space.  (Contributed by NM, 2-Apr-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)
